1.content:
"It's here!" excited, Daniel yelled. "The Reality Game is finally here!"

Daniel had saved up his money for months to be able to order the latest reality bending game. It allowed the player to live out any life he or she wished. There were two types of this game; one for boys and the other for girls. Being small for his age, looking more like a twelve year old than sixteen, Daniel did not make the football team so he ordered the game for boys in hopes of living the life of a football player.

Only all of his hopes were dashed when he opened the package; the game was pink in color. It was the girls' version of the game. "But I ordered the boys' version of the game!" angry and confused, Daniel said. "I know I did; I checked it three times!"

"What's wrong, bro?" entering Daniel's room, Sophie asked. "Something wrong with the game you ordered from Reality Inc.?"

"Just everything, Sophie!" angry, Daniel yelled. "I ordered the boys' version of the game and they sent me the girl version! I can't live the life of a girl!"

"What's wrong with being a girl?" with a fake look of hurt, Sophie asked.

"I was not born one, that's what is wrong!" tearing up, Daniel yelled. "It would be too... weird!"

"Well, the game has a money back guarantee." with the hint of a smile, Sophie said. "Why not at least give it a try?"

Daniel looked as if he was about to be sick. "You can't be serious!" angry, he screamed. "Why would I want to try being a girl at any time!?"

"You have been on pins and needles, waiting for this to arrive." serious, Sophie replied. "I don't think I can take your pacing much longer. At least give the game a try. If you don't like it, you can send it back in exchange for the boy version."

Daniel looked at his sister as if she had lost her mind only, after some pleading, he finally gave in and hooked the game equipment. It was fairly basic with its own digital monitor, the game console, and two wireless controllers. Once everything was set up, Daniel turned on the game and stood in front of the monitor where a message read, 'Please hold still while you are scanned.'

"Scanned?" curious, he thought.

Suddenly, a number of green beams of light fired from a round lens in the game console. It hit Daniel in various points. After a few second, the beams of light vanished and a new message appeared on the screen. Please select your character age.

Daniel looked at the options and saw...

1251111122.content:
As a customer enters the store, you feel your body moving of it's own accord over to the armoured warrior.
"Welcome to Anarion, my name is Alicia, how can I help you today?" you said "Do you perhaps need some enchanting done, some potions for use on your adventures?"
"Yes, as a matter of fact," said the warrior "Myself and my party have had the fortunate luck to stumble upon a dragon's hoard, a dragon that we were told was long dead. We've disabled most of the traps, and defeated the monsters guarding it, but we are unfortunately lacking a magician, and the last few traps and barriers are magical. We're willing to pay you for your services, as well as any money we need to identify any items we find, which we will use your shop exclusively for."
"You have not yet told us your name," you said "I prefer to know who I'm working for before I agree to any deals."
The warrior removed his helmet, to reveal a handsome male human, in his early twenties.
"My name is Deran," said the man "And I can vouch personally for the rest of my party. If any of them double cross you, I can promise I will compensate you for it."
"Very well," you said "Come on, Terra, we gotta go, can you lock up?"
Sophie automatically grabbed the keys and followed the two of them out the door.

"Lead on, Deran," said 'Terra'
"Do you have horses?" he asked "It's a bit of a ways off."
You led the way behind the shop, which was called 'Anarion- Relics of the Ancient World', to a small stable separate from the shop. Leading the horses out of the stable, and going to where Deran's horse was grazing. Getting on the horses, Deran led the way out of town and over a hill to an old tomb that they had found the hoard in. Two men and an elf woman stood outside, tending to horses of their own. One of the men wore a green hood, and had a bow and quiver of arrows over his back, and leather armour. The other man wore what appeared at first glance to be commoner clothes, but you noticed cleverly concealed armour, and the glint of several daggers in concealed pockets on his clothes. The elven woman appeared to be in noble garb, and had a fancy dagger on her waist.

"This is Terrence, Sal and Selastine," said Deran, gesturing to the hooded one, the leather armoured one and the elf woman respectively.
Terrence led the way into the tomb, moving quickly over weapons discarded from skeletons that had sword gouges on them. Over bottomless pits, under or around collapsed ceilings, until they came to a door with a runic circle on it.
"What do you make of this?" asked Terra, examining the runic circle "Seems to be a combination of divine and arcane symbols."
"What will it do if we trigger it?" asked Deran
"Basically, it'll funnel all the energy contained within that circle down the corridor directly at us," you said, not entirely sure how you know it.
"You guys can bring it down, right?" asked Terrence
"I believe so," said Terra "But these symbols are so intertwined, it'll be very easy to set it off. We should take precautions first. Alicia? Put up a barrier, please."

You pull out some chalk, and begin drawing a circle, putting several different symbols within it.
"Stand inside the circle, please," you said. The four party members stood inside the circle. You began chanting, and the circle began glowing.
"You four should be safe inside the circle, if we set this off, it'll kill us, but you four should be unharmed," you said "You're not confined to the circle, but I'd advise you stay there until we've disabled the circle."
You turned back to the circle, and you and Sophie held up your hands in front of the rune circle on the door.
The circle glowed slightly, and several of the runes came forwards, splitting up and going to either side. Some then vanished, as they were disabled completely. When all of the runes had vanished, the circle vanished into the door.

"Clear," you said, waving your hands over the protective circle on the floor, which floated up, shrank and wrapped itself around your right wrist.
"Take positions," said Deran, moving to the front of the group, as Terrence went to the centre, Sal with him, and Selastine went to the back. You remained in the centre, as Terra went forwards. Beyond the door is...

The dragon hoard was far more extensive than anything you had seen before. Mountains of gold coins littered the floor of the cavernous chamber, many, many intricately made weapons, many with jewel-encrusted hilts. Deran stepped into the room, looking around at the mountains around you. As he walked towards the gold, one of his feet depresses a tile on the floor. Immediately, the gold began to slide towards the group, as a red-coloured hide appeared underneath, red wings unfolded slightly, the dragon towered over you all. It opened it's mouth, a strange gas began to coalesce in it's throat. You conjured a fireball in your hand and threw it into the dragon's mouth. The gas exploded, the dragon fell down, it's head smoking.

"I thought you said this dragon was dead," you said, as you blew on your hands.
"It was," said Deran, nervously "I don't like this. Let's get out of here before he wakes up."
"He's unconscious now," said Terrence "Why don't we just kill him now?"
"His hide is too tough," said Selastine "We aren't equipped to fight something like this."
"How the hell did you knock it out?" asked Sal "I've never seen anything like that."
"I got lucky," you said "I probably won't be next time."

You awoke to find yourself underwater. Feeling the rebreather over your mouth and nose, you felt calm. You uncrossed your legs, from the meditative position you had been floating in, and looked around. You were in a small, underwater cave. A rope made of strange material was tied around your wrist and tethered to a large, metal ring. Two more tethers led to a woman and a girl. Though you could not see yourself, you assumed that she was identical to you. The woman rose from her meditation.
"Dani? What's wrong?" The voice came over the comm-link that was built into the rebreather aparatus that was helping her to breath.
"What's going on? Where am I?" asked Dani
"You don't remember?" asked the woman "We ran from the temple when Vader attacked. We came here to hide while I complete your training, as-well as my own."
So this must be Knight Assla, which meant he was either Padawan Dani.
"I do, now, Master," said Dani "Though I wish I hadn't. Why did we run? Why didn't we fight?"
"The leader of the Clone Troopers was strong in the Dark Side," said Assla "You had only just been brought to the temple. I've told you this before, Dani, we've been hiding here for ten years. I understand sharing your memories with your sister can make it difficult to focus sometimes, but just focus on your meditations. The two of you are ready for the next stage of your training, or so I thought. We can always wait, Dani, there is no harm in being cautious."
"No," said Dani "I'm ready. We need to return to the galaxy we ran from, and fight back."
"I think I know where we need to go," said Assla "If it's true what they say, Coruscant won't be safe, and our ship identification codes would immediately identify us as Jedi, not something we want to advertise, these days, if the comm chatter I've picked up is anything to go by."

Executing a perfect somersault, you land on your feet, as Sophia stands up on ground level. Your feet echoed on the cave floor. They felt a rumbling, as the stone pillar rotated, it's stone legs pulling apart as it's arms unstuck from it's body.
"What manner of beast be thee, that comes to me on Delta Three?"
You saw that Sophia was still paralysed with shock, so you replied.
"We seek your crystals, man of rock, for a mission of great import," You decided to attempt to match him for his rhymes, weather this was required, but you decided to do it, regardless.
"Danger lies ahead for you, no matter which path you walk, my crystals carry power, maybe too much for the likes of you?"
"Too much, or not, we must have them," said Sophia "For if we don't, our quest is not done."
The stone being turned it's massive head to look down at your sister.
"You are reckless, little one," said the golem "I am the balance, I know your fate. Your sister will die by your hand."
You hated prophecies. Do you try to prevent them, and be the thing that brings them about in the first place, or allow things to happen as they should, and witness the thing you feared come to pass?

"Speak your mind, Dani," said Assla, standing from the meditative position she had assumed in her quarters on the ship. "I'm your guardian, you can tell me anything."
"It's about what happened in the cave," you said "The creature within claimed to know our fate. I refused to hear it, for I believe our destiny is not yet written. Is there any truth to what he says?"
Assla did not speak for a few moments, and the humming of the ship's engines punctuated the silence.

"There have been Jedi in the past who were able to sense what was to come," said Assla "Almost all of them attempted to prevent that which was seen, but in so doing, it led them down a dark path, which ended in them bringing about the very event they were trying to avoid. You were wise not to hear the creature's prophecy. It may have led you down a dark path."

"Was there not a prophecy of the Chosen One?" you asked "I thought he was supposed to destroy the Sith and bring balance to the Force? Why was he attacking the Temple?"

"Prophecies have been misread in the past," said Assla "Misinterpreted. It is why I have trained you in the use of the Force, but allowed you to make up your own mind what to feel. I did not agree with many of the tenets of the Jedi. One of my best friends, Etain Mur Tukan fell in love with a clone trooper. She proved through that love and the way she remained true to herself, that trusting in the Force does not require one to give up attachments. The Force is neither light nor dark. It is merely a tool in the toolbox. Something that people fear. Dark and light. Evil and Good. They're all just two sides of the same coin. It's not the Force that is evil or good, it's the people that use it."

"Thank you for that, Master," said Dani
"Just call me Assla," said Assla "That title only carries weight within the Jedi Order which no longer exists."

"This can't be happening!" you said, panicking "How is this happening?"
You attempted to run over to the games console to turn it off before something worse happened, but fell to the ground as soon as you tried to stand up. Looking down, you saw that your legs had fused together into a long tail, similar to a mermaid. As you looked at the games console, it and the tv vanished, as the walls changed to rock, the door merging into the rock walls. The bed changed, which Sophie was still on, poking at her own tail, had also changed to rock. Looking up, you saw that an opening had opened in the roof, and water was pouring in rapidly, quickly filling up the room, until you were floating above the ground, at about the same level as Sophie, who was still engrossed in examining her body, and new tail. Sophie had finally realised that the room was filling up with water, and was starting to panic. Sophie had only just started swimming lessons, and was still a little scared of the water. You dived below the rising water level, moving through the water easily, you guessed due to your new physiology. You put your feminine arms around Sophie, muttering "It's ok, it's ok," Amazingly, your voice carried under the water, as water filled your lungs, you were surprised to find that you were able to breathe normally. Holding Sophie close, you looked around again at your surroundings as the water level rose to the hole in the ceiling. There was another bed on the other rock shelf similar to what your bed had turned into on the other side of the room. It was much wider than the one the two of you were now floating slightly above, and there were two rings instead of one. There was some rope tied to these rings, you guessed to stop you from drifting while you slept, and there was a few closed containers. On a much higher up shelf, four small cylinders were tied to another iron ring. Sophie had calmed down, and had started moving around the cave, trying to get used to moving with her new tail.

Now that you were closer, she realised that two of the cylinders looked oddly familiar to you. When your hands closed around them you felt a sense of rightness that you hadn't felt since you had woken up in this body. Untying them from the iron ring, you picked both of them up, closing your eyes, feeling that sense of rightness fill you up. You closed your eyes, and breathed in and out, feeling that sense of rightness permeate you, from the tip of the long hair reaching out behind you like a party streamer, to the tip of your long, emerald tail, that still felt so alien, but so right at the same time. You reached out with your sense of rightness, your eyes closed. You felt Sophie, still exploring the cave around you, and as you pushed out your mind further, you somehow felt the life around you: the plants, the fish, even someone unfamiliar, yet familiar at the same time. As you reached out further, you felt something else. Something mechanical, manufactured. It was approaching the familiar presence fast. You tore yourself out of your meditation, your body almost on autopilot, you moved your hands so they were against your body, and began moving faster than you remembered ever moving before, towards this strange presence. You held the cylinders next to you, as you came up on the familiar presence. It was a human woman, in her mid twenties by the look of her, and she was moving as fast as she could away from a white armoured figure not far behind her. You handed the woman one of the cylinders, pressing a nub on one area of it to activate the lightsaber, and barrelled towards the scuba clone, dodging the harpoon gun with reflexes you didn't know you had, and sliced off his gun arm before stabbing him in the chest, allowing him to float off. You knew instinctively that you had to protect this woman, who you guessed was Knight Assla, and you knew she couldn't see as-well as you. She had ignited the lightsaber you had given her, but was gazing around, unable to see if any of her assailants were around her. 13.content:
Daniel's body continued to shift and warp as green waves passed through him, but strangely nothing really happened yet. A green hologram popped up and read "Push to confirm age. Current age selected: 12. Confirm/Deny?" It read with two large holographic buttons near the bottom in front of the lense.

"Well, that's not such a bad age. How about twelve? You already look twelve, why not be twelve?" His sister sophie suggested.

"Twelve, only TWELVE? What, no way. That doesn't sound like a fun experience at all. I wanted to be a footballer player, if I cannot do that I might as well do a stronger option for it." Daniel insisted instead. He continued to look through the options, going through the ages but finding out it only goes up to 16 for him. "What, why aren't there any options for older ages?" He complained.

"I guess the game doesn't let you take on an older age, or any older than you already are. Maybe what it considers you mentally or physically? She added.

"Wait a darn minute, are you saying I'm not mature? I am plenty mature!" Daniel said, sticking his tongue out and making raspberries. Sophie rolled her eyes.

"And anyway, you said it yourself I only look about 12 physically, so there clearly wouldn't be restrictions on my physical age above 12 up to 16 if that were true."

Sophie sighed. "All right, good point bro, so just choose an option and hit confirm. Be 12, really what's the worse that can happen? I don't really see any harm in trying it out."

Daniel, rather angry wanted to argue with her further, but being upset enough about only getting a female version of the game said "Fine. Let's see what they have for 12."

He clicked 'Confirm' and another light scanned through, this time red, beeping and blinking at him rapidly as red and green bands glowed around his body suddenly. He could feel like his body was constricting, like someone was pulling on it like taffy trying to compress him, but no real changes occurred just yet. It must be all sort of building in and in waiting until all the options have been decided.
"Look at all these options Dan! Which should we choose?" Sophie asked.

"Let's try some stereotypes. You always here about these sorts of things on TV and in shows, even if they're only half-way accurate, wouldn't it be fun to live exactly like the embodiment of one?" Sophie explained.

"Stereotypes, eh.. I'm not so sure. That seems sort of risky, I don't want to get into any trouble or feel weird emulating some caricature of a person." Despite his comment, she wasn't listening and tapped the Stereotypes list. He sighed as he picked up the controller and scrolled down through the list of options.

There were all sorts of stereotypes, from typical ones like Cheerleaders and bubbly airheaded blonds, to less acknowledged like Goths and Emos, punks, alternative scene kids, jocks and nerds, and other lingering options like Stepford Child, Goody Two Shoes, Spoiler Brat, Religious Devout, Science junkie, Fat Kid, Class clown, Class Klutz, 'Special needs', Agricultural Enthusiast, Hippie Flowerchild, and the list went on and on.

Dan wasn't as keen of most of these options, and they got more bizarre and different sounding as he went down. There was even an option called "Weird foreign kid", which reminded him of this one student in his class, Ja'ör-skieen Mallory who spoke in a thick European accent, always wore faux leather to school, quoted the Beetles, couldn't be seen without the stick of a licorice flavored lolly in his mouth, and offered Sage-like advice with other weird tics.

Suddenly Daniel was beginning to really regret this decision to play this game.

"Goth! Do a goth, I've always wanted to have a goth sister, that'd be so cool." Sophie insisted, trying to scroll back up on the hologram and choose the Goth Option.

"Oh heck no! I don't want to be some weird freaky goth girl. If anything, I might as well pick the obvious option, a perky cheerleader or buxom blond. Atleast that way I'll get to enjoy myself." Daniel responded.

"So you just want to be some sort of giggly blond bimbo? Ugh, that's so typical. Why are all men so predictable?" She lamented.

"I'd RATHER, not be anything at all if possible. But if I have to decide, I don't really know how some of these options would work with a 12 year old girl, but I'm just saying I'd rather pick the least harmful one to live as. And a blond or cheerleader does not mean 'Bimbo', whose stereotyping now?" Daniel pointed out, scrolling back up to the top.

"Look, Goths are like, open minded and cool and stuff right? If you pick that, you're like to hold onto yourself the most, maybe even gain an ounce of maturity or two, even as a twelve old girl. You could have a lot of fun you know!" Sophie pointed at the goth option as she argued for it's favor.

"Or I could end up some moody snob or flirty fetish-fueled nightmare. There's a lot to a stereotype you know, it's a bit of a gamble." Jon complained. "Ugh, whatever. Let's just get this over with."

With a wide smile on her face, Sophie insisted with finality that he choose the.....

With reluctance, the two selected the "Adventurous Goth" and all the suboptions to the side popped up. 1321321.title: Adventurous Goth! Time for their story to unfold..

choices: A vast canyon with relics to spare
13213211.content:
A cold and drifting air drifted over Daniel. He shivered and woke up suddenly in a hazy mist, taking in the thin breezy air and sullen rock floor he was resting on. As he got up, he heard the sound of rattling and clunky knickknacks against him, with a weight and feeling to occupy it. As if it wasn't enough to confirm their presence, Daniel felt the objects across his body, chains rattling near his waist, a silver stopwatch lodged in his pocket, and slight metal cuffs around his wrist.

He was frightened that he might have been jailed or in danger, but they didn't restrict his mobility at all, and most of the chains and objects weren't connected to anything. Looking down from where he got up, a cotton white shirt with plaid trimmings adorned his chest underneath a long frock coat. He wore a beige leather skirt, latched with metal attachments, and along his legs Gardner Belts and striped wool stockings. Knee high stomper boots made with a velvety brown fabric encased his shins, and it seemed like some sort of brace or mechanism was locked around it as well. A pair of spiffy goggles decorated her forehead strapped comfortably. Despite the heavy cloak, skirt and boots he strangely found he could walk just fine, better even. Was he made of helium? Other than his braced leg, every part of him just felt bustling with energy.

He felt feather wait, and although clearly in a spry 12 year old's female body, the body was mobile and highly spunky. He felt like a superhero, and almost had to restrain his movements at first because the lightweight agility almost threw him off. When he finally got up and leaned over the giant pillar he was resting against, 'Daniel' brushed off the dust from his frock and shoulders. Along with running his fingers into the tied back hair combed in, he started cupping the poofy bangs across his face and sassy swirls of hair over his shoulders before being startled by a beep.

A message appeared on the screen, giving him the first glimpse of his new appearance. Being identical to the girl in the display, he looked like some Victorian girl out of a pulp novel or children's book.

"Welcome New Player, Elma Rosenberg, 12 year old Plucky wonderchild and courageous, daring heir of the Rosenberg name." A note popped up under a bunch of descriptions and summaries he skimmed over. The thing that caught his eye was, First objective: Examine surroundings, get accustomed to new setting. Find something interesting and 'Sight a shooting star'. Goal completion earns, 5 Points. 100 required points to complete and finish Game.

Sighting his surroundings? That seemed like an easy enough task. From what he could see the sky was slightly smoggy, air cold, ground hard yet brittle, and himself anxious to see what more.

Utilizing the virtual abnormal strength he'd acquired, Elma pressed her stompers against the ground, creating small fissures in the earth beneath her feet. Steam and bustling proceeded in her brace, feeling like someone was giving it a tight squeeze or grope, and in less than a second later she was off, soaring vertically into the air several meters ahead.

She landed exhilarated, never having felt anything like it before. She landed atop the pillar, and gave the new world a good look.

Facing her ahead was...
13213211.title: Welcome to the new world

choices: Elma makes her way to these towers
132132111.content:
Vast canyons and magnificent sights greeted her. From her pillar, she could see only a portion of it, but a rusty valley seemed to stretch out for miles. Wind swept through cliffsides and rocky ground, going through the gorges and edges of the landscape, and finding it's way through her bangs, bristling in the breeze. Slight rays and beams of sunlight shot through the sky, but most of it was obscured by dull clouds and a sepia tones skyline. By the location of the sun obscured behind the haze, she could tell it was about a little before noon.

"Well, the game told me to start earning points I have to explore don't I? So I might as well do that. Time to get going!"

Elma reassured herself. It was strange, she was so nervous and uncertain about trying this game out so little ago, but now she felt a weird surge of confidence and almost, brash giddy pride fill her up. She wasn't scared at all! 'She' wondered if that was part of the mental effects at all? She recalled there might have been a risk for changed like that.

Either way she figured she best not to dwell on it, and pressed herself down in a leaping position, like an Olympic medalist with their eyes on the pride. Her brace activated with clogs and steam again, and she made a massive leap forward into the valley. And another, and so on. It was amazing she thought, she was hardly the most athletic as a boy back in reality, but here as Elma she might as well be one with the wind herself. The speed and grace for which her spirit soared, felt charitably bold, maybe even adventurous.

After soaring and leaping bounds through the cliff sides, she looked up and spotted the first 'unusual' thing, well more so to the land since she'd arrived. Some pillars and hills had tilted and raised upwards, giving definition to the photographic scene. But rising from the midst of the valley, were titanic Towers raising towards the sky, tall and towering over the land. They were like skyscrapers built in the middle of these rocky lands, and were obviously built appropriately so.

Elma pulled down her goggles and tried to focus a little closer. Aside from the smog fuming from the top, Antennas and machinery whizzed at the very top of them hundreds of feet up, and large pipes coiled it at the bottom and disappeared into the earth's surface from a distance. She couldn't explain it and had never seen such a thing, but for reasons unknown to her Elma felt instant surges of ghastly horror and hatred for these behemoth structures.

She hopped on a tall hill, and scanned around. In the very distance perhaps miles apart, the visions of more ominous towers scattered off in the distance was apparent. Elma instinctively grit her teeth and gripped her fingerless gloves.

Unforgiving place
132132111.title: An Explorer are we? Tally ho!

1321321111.content:
Racing faster than any car, roller-coaster or ride she'd ever been in or experienced before back in her original life, Elma made tracts through the land with excessive haste. Previously one with the wind, now she moved past it and felt the crisp and gloomy air against her face, brushing her hair, working against her body. She focused her legs harder and accelerated. The faster she moved, the tighter her brace strangled her leg, but she ignored it, all while it blasted out steam like a furious engine.

It strained her only slightly to move ahead like this, but something about the tower just made her so mad, even if she wasn't given any context as to why. Her speedy travels were interrupted at one point when trekking only a few hundred feet from the Tower.

"What? What is that?" She quickly dove behind a nearby pillar and got down in it's shade, hugging the back of it for her life. The spotlight from above shone atop the pillar, but didn't venture towards her before it passed away and the floating vehicle above slowly patrolled away.

Elma gave a quick glance and then anchored her bottom rear onto the ground, splitting out her legs forward and stretching with a long yawn. "I didn't know I still got tired in this game. I thought I was pretty limitless, but I guess the game set some realism." Her leg was sore and panged sharply at the girth ring where the Brace restricted it.

It was a heck of a lot to admire, this crazy game so far. Daniel, taking a moment to pause himself and reassert his concentration away from being 'Elma' , took a deep breathe and tried to recount the events before sprinting forward again. With game-magic steam powered legs no less. He reached his hand out and as if by his command, a mini-menu popped out. He'd begun the game roughly 42 minutes ago and had spent a little over the last half hour exploring. There was no inventory, but he tried to go back to that information that would summarize anything helpful. It was hard to believe he was an ordinary boy before than, but now his young girl form, his eloquent clothes, his gadgets, had all transformed him into this, this splunk heroine she was now.

Catching her breath, she took off one of her leathery stompers and let that foot breathe. It was probably best to rest for a moment anyway, even if some part of her mind seemingly didn't want to.
1321321111.title: A small delay on the way

choices: Elma reads up some more as she rest
13213211111.content:
Catching her breath, she tugged off one of her leathery stompers and let that foot breathe as surely as her virtual lungs. .

"Ow ow OOww.. what the?" And the instant she did it felt numb and stinging in pain. It was sore from the brace earlier, but now it was like someone just ripped a band-aide off him. The brace, slightly loose and out of steam since he'd stopped dangled loosely. She carefully untwisted two knobs at the knee, pulled off a latch near the top, and the brace dissembled into three parts, a top, bottom and 'lock' part that held it together.

Unfortunately for Elma, the soreness relieved gave way to a pang of numbness. "Ahhh, what now?" Elma had gotten use to her new body so quickly, but this was something new. The stripped leg, free'd of it's weight couldn't even move, it was like a dead weight being dragged from the stiffer upper portions. Deeply grooved marks were indented into her skin from the tightness of it constricting her leg for so long, and there were two metal devices built into gashes in her flesh left from where the knobs were before.

She'd expected this game to come with some unique restrictions, but thought the fancy costume and equipment was only for show, like in any videogame. The other items didn't seem to weigh anything, so why did taking it off make her feel paralyzed in one leg? She couldn't even lift it or stand now like this.

As if following his mental curiosity, a menu screen began to panel information off. Elma examined closely;

"Elma Rosenberg, Twelve year old genius explorer inventor and beloved, affluent prodigal vagabond, often gets by on her rigorous travels by her specialized Steel mechanical brace, The Automated Anatomical Interject System, or AAIM was built by hers truly, to compensate for an abrasive weakness and fracture induced paralysis in her right leg, caused by an unfortunate childhood accident, one rearing indicative of her personal choice as a vagrant. She spent two years inbetween a hospital, crutches and immobile in bed, but upon devising her AAIM invention to suit her own needs, she became free as a bee to roam the world and see fit to it's exploration as she wished, with her own personal mobile device strapped to her legs.."

"Great, so I've got the body of somebody crippled? How could a 12 year old girl have to go through this. I mean, both the sad paralysis thing, but than being able, or having to deal with.. this?" She sighed, picking up the metal parts. She relaxed her head and let some time pass, freeing up her leg to rest easy and free as it recovered.
13213211111.title: Disabled and yet Clearly advantaged

choices: Investigating the mystery of the Black Tower
132132111111.content:
"Elma's genius and innovative AAIM device attaches mechanically to her working thighs across her Femur and lodges into her Fibula, bending and using flexisteel jointed technology to act in place of her defective paralytic muscles manually. The AIM itself works by emulating her structural support systems, only more efficiently and with far stronger superior output."

"Superior? Yeah, you could say that." She quipped.

"The hydraulics of the AIM itself works with a specially designed fluid-motion capture system, with the vascular space between the flexisteel joints, using high-powered water to pressurize them and give them fluid, strongly crafted movement much how natural muscles move with fibers and blood contractions. The stronger the heated water is applied, the more energy and heat is required, thus the steam coming out of valves uptop the brace. This miraculous technology has allowed the flighty exploratory Elma to get around where she needs with blinding speed and passing ease, whereas she'd be immobile to basic walking functions. And all a product of her own design and ingenious."

Elma examined one of the top parts of the brace and sure enough, a small casket of water the size of a canister was wired up to lodges in the brace. A slight knock sort of showed it was slightly lightweight, and when he bent it like rubbery plastic it was truly like flexible steel, bending back into place once released. "Huh, a steam powered body augmentation system? This might just be the coolest character I could have chosen yet. Who knows how lame those other lives could have been compared to this."

Dragging her body along and peaking just slightly over the structure, she saw the large flying vehicle finally far away enough now, veering in the opposite direction and soon to be behind the tower. She'd have plenty of time before it ever spotted her, she figured. Picking up the pieces of her leg's equipment, as if by instinct she started putting it back together, front back and top piece snapping like a seatbelt around her leg, with the two knobs tightening back around the holed gashes in her leg. A quick jolt of pain went through her spine, like getting a shot or pinch, but it soon went away and felt as natural as she'd feel wearing it her whole life.

With only a bit of delay, it started to feel lightweight again and she felt that it could move. Rubbing the tips of the brace, when she held it carefully she could feel a slight warmth, and supposed that was the water running through it. How hot would it be to touch when she was speeding ahead like before and steaming outwards? She didn't care to find that out, but regardless knew she'd be traveling like that again in a moment.

Standing up and feeling the wind brush her hair, she tightened the chains on her frock, pulled back the sassy curls of hair into the scrunched ones and donned on her stomper boot. Elma figured it was time to pay visit to that black idol, the heathen reaching towards and clogging up the skies.
132132111111.title: Beep Boop: Elma is a cyborg..haha

1321321111111.content:
When it was assured that the flying ship, shining a light down below as it drifted around was out of sight, and her legs had recovered, Elma decided it was time to go pay one of the Towers a visit.

As she speeded up again, she wondered what they were doing here, and why she felt so much natural resentment for it, like it was built into her character. If this was one of the mental effects, would it be crucial to her story or game? She still had the whole Exploring goal afterall, and she supposed exploring the tower monolith thing up ahead was part of that. If only it'd given her additional memories too, maybe she could figure it out sooner.

Pacing herself and going more easy on her pumping legs, now that she knew they had limits and could over-exert themselves, she raced towards it, close in sight. Even while exhilarating her senses by moving at this lowered speed, she was probably on par with nature's finest. She'd certainly outrun any Olympic sprinter or highway conundrum. Why, at her fastest she could probably compete in NASCAR, if she wanted to over-exert herself and set her legs ablaze. They were warm enough with the brace around them, aside from her own instinct and pacing, she could tell her speed by the heat of the steam alone.

After a decent well jogged journey, she'd crossed the canyon over and made her way right to it. Here was one, a massive monolith of black steel and ivory machinery looming before her. The tower looked more like some kind of factory or giant dynamite stick upclose, smooth and daunting, hundreds of feet up. She didn't suppose even at her strongest leap she could mount that. Because the tower's surface was so smooth she wouldn't be climbing it either. There was no entrance visible anywhere she could see, no windows or sidewalks in the middle of the bare canyon. The only place for entry was in a giant hole up-top high high up, with a landing platform. She had a good guess what that was for.

Pipes big enough to house an elephant spiraled out of the bottom of structure and dug deep into the ground. Elma hopped around and climbed her way up onto some of them, inspecting the way they spiraled in and out, with an red glow within the pipes, and a strange luminescent light blue one emitting out from their entry.

The red glow atleast, was traceable. Where they'd dug into the ground away from the tower, heated cracks followed. Elma searched away.
1321321111111.title: Getting a good look upclose

13213211111111.content:
Elma played hopscotch with the glowing cracks ahead. They seemed to go out in all directions from the tower, and went long past the pipes in the earth's crust that caused them. She hopped and skipped back and forth between their contours streaking the canyon, careful not to touch them.

Following the first couple didn't really lead anywhere. They usually just leveled out eventually, but in some parts were wide enough to expel out heated viscous fluid, gooey and bubbling across the earth. She figured it was probably molten Magma, what else would it be?

This continued for a while, and while sometimes Daniel felt somewhat bored or impatient, the part of him that was Elma felt excited and curious at what this phenomenon meant. She didn't want to slow down or quit, even after playing hopscotch for what seemed like miles, and luckily for her this persistence paid off. One stream she followed lead to a particular nasty crack, which flowed into a whole river of lava cascading down a cliff. The waterfall of heated material escorted down into a large hole in the earth's surface.

"Oh snap! Guess it's time to dig a little lower." Elma realized, wiping her brow from all the heat and looking for a safe entryway. It was already past noon and the sun was starting to lower, she told herself if there was any time to look, I'd be now.

Jumping like a cougar swiping it's pray, she swiftly strode into the side of the underground cavern, careful to avoid the falling flow of lava pouring from above. Luckily, the walls and space was wide enough that she could travel down with a fairly large margin of safety. She gripped a cliffside and slowly began making her descent, putting one foot after the other and climbing down. The light fading out wasn't a problem, the hot red waterfall provided a pretty good lamp, and there seemed to be some light coming from below aswell.
13213211111111.title: Investigative Inquiry for the Inquizzically Minded

choices: The intensity of the glow glistens
The sounds of tremors are heard
132132111111111.content:
Elma clasped at a bare edge of a rock across the dirty wall of crust. Another pull, another step, a slight jump, a careful tug and strained movement. The heat of the pouring lava nearby sweltered, but it only made her more anxious to see what followed. She licked her lips and wiped the sweat from her brow, taking another step on a more comfortable ledge to grasp. Within a climb that would put the most experienced expedition goer to shame, Elma had climbed down with no trouble at all.

She hopped onto a platform right above where the lava finally landed and flowed, narrowing into a river up ahead. Across the side of the wall led to a deep cavern, one illuminated by the fiery river of what she could only assume to be the catechism of the depths of hell. But she wasn't about to start quoting scripture, with a powerful leap she hopped over the river and landed on a rocky safe pathway that ran alongside the flow, and made haste rummaging inside. It's bowls went deep into the earth, she went forward and made a curve and continued exploring. Even underground, the lava made the cavern warm and sweltering. Eventually pathway stopped and the stream expanded out indefinitely, simply flowing forever and presumably back into and underneath the land. But there was one stroke of luck for her to behold.

The luminescence of a blue aura flowed out of an entry way uptop, another cavern with a cavern here, above where the melting rivers flowed indefinitely. With a stern push of her legs, she leaped 20 feet and just barely made it to the edge, gripping her fingers and pulling herself up and in. Giving one last look at the heated reservoir of boiling magma below, she continued inwards to see what she may find next.
132132111111111.title: Descending earthwards

1321321111111111.content:
The dirty room brightened, it glimmered a pulsing rich blue as Elma went further in. Just earlier she had walked by a stream of red hot fluid, but now walking away from it the temperature was rather chilled, but not unbearable. More interesting was the brightness of her travels, she hadn't lost sight of any light yet. She had vaguely remembered a place looking like this at a roller skating rink she went to once as Daniel, on some boogie or disco night was it?

However this was unlike anything she had ever seen. As she got closer and deeper into the belly of the subterranean, she'd seen wonders not witnessed as a dull boy. The lights shone deep twinkling blue, like fairy lights twirling and dancing throughout an irradiated darkness. But hardly radioactive or seething with virulent heat or harm, these lights were musical, magical, mystical and something of an otherworldly sight to behold. Beautiful.

Elma peaked by behind a nearby stalagmite, and watched them dance slowly. Like fawning, whimsical fairies, they danced in organized patterns and strobes of color, from cyan to Cerulean, each in an orderly and sophisticated pattern of arrangement. The lights, the would-be fairies sprouted not pixie dust but elaborate patterns on the walls, which upon looking closer, Elma realized were something like webs or cocoons of sorts, each interconnected in marvelous patterns that not even the choicest of quilters could deny of it's lavish wonder.

Each time they were struck with a different light in the pattern of darling creatures, they sparked luminescent, electrifying and lighting up like a show of fireworks across a web, or daring display that no real world bill board or sign could match. It was naturally and unrelentingly, aesthetically, gracefully charmed and exquisite. An elegance of nature nothing else could hope to match. Poking one, Elma found them to be light as cotton candy, but abit more durable. She pinched a strand of some off and pocketed it in her frock for later.

It was so beautiful, Elma had to chuckle for a moment to suddenly realize that it was all artificial,as part of a quest or game that had been designed and provided for him. But that didn't make it any less cool to see.

Elma walked in the ring of their marching, flying whimsy orchestra. They didn't fear her, but continued their dance all the same. She stuck her hand out, and let one fly gently into her palm. No smaller than a grape, the wonder had beady eyes, a round body like a beetle or ladybug, but long wings like a dragonfly. It was the slick and reflective black coat of it's shell, along with the electrical blue hue and beat of it's wings that gave it it's distinctive light and pattern, which combined with the sync of it's own kin made for a fantastically lovely sight.

Elma lost herself in the moment and danced, spending some time to take in the bold fresh sights before her, and reap the sows of her efforts and finest appreciations. She smiled and laughed and skipped, joining them in their merry song of life, the virtual creatures not object at all to their guest dancing with their colorful ballad.
1321321111111111.title: The luminary subterranean starchildren

13213211111111111.content:
Elma danced and witnessed the beautiful horde's sight for what seemed like hours to come. Eventually, with a satisfied yawn, she bid the sight goodbye, waving playfully and making her way out. She hopped back onto the ledge and followed the trail of magma back up to it's surfacing source, where nightfall had cometh. With little more difficulty than before, she climbed here way up and out and soon was visited with the cold air of the world once more. Tiptoeing her way through the cracks and soon back onto the pipes again, she found her way to where they reached into the Tower at it's lowest walls.

Looking closely, the hazing blue pulse emitted out was none too familiar. She took out the strand of web she had saved, and saw the same blue light charging through it's fibers. They matched identically. She wasn't completely sure what this meant for her game goal or what to make of it, but it was a connection well made.

It wouldn't be the only one to confirm her suspicions. A few minutes later, a light shone near the tower, and a red beacon flashed out of the very top as the large entryway opened up. The light sure enough, was from the searchlights of a large flying ship, looking like some sort of blimp or airship, the same one that had patrolled around it earlier. It made it's stop on the landing platform, which than retracted into the entryway before the gates closed once again and the night resumed it's silence.

"Pfft. Knew it." Elma quipped. She stretched out and began throttling forward, out into the wild of the canyon again. Elma didn't know for certain how this game worked, or atleast the parts from here. She sat down on a tall hill and tensed her arms behind her neck, looking towards the virtual sky. She wondered not whether she was spending an equal amount of real life time in the game, but if she should be tired specifically, or whatnot. She'd certainly done most of the things she thought she did.

"Game, check Goals accomplished, please."

A short list popped up of all his objectives for the first goal.

Examine surroundings - Complete


"Well, She certainly had seen quite a lot and examined as much as he could so far. From the canyons, the Tower in the middle of it, to somewhere underground. She's say he was certainly done that."

Get accustomed to new setting - Complete

"More than done. Everything in it felt so natural, and she felt more than one with Elma now, so much that his old sluggish body seemed like a distant memory. The sights she seemed pretty accustomed to now as well."

Find something interesting - Complete


"Well, if the ominous Tower, Airships and underground caves didn't do it, I'd say that amazing bug show was as interesting as I'll find in a while. Definitely finished. So that only leaves..."

Sight a shooting star - Incomplete


"The shooting star. Right right, but were in god names am I going to find a... a... Great heavens to betsy, son of a dickens. I guess I should have expected that. That's, that's..."

Sight a shooting star - Complete


In the corner of his vision, he sighted it. As soon as he had finished listing off the other three, a shooting star appeared. As a trail of light streaked across the sky it made it's way south back further, the opposite direction of where he first started. It lit up the night with a slight red hue, giving a magnificent homage to fortune in the glimpse of his now red eye, reflecting prosperity in the star that had just fallen

"That's the freakin jackpot."

Within seconds, steam littered the air and blasted where he once sat. The adventurous, bold and affluent prodigal vagrant, Elma Rosenberg was off. The stars had painted her a map to the treasure she'd been told to seek, and she'd race off sparing no time to claim her prize, one that was literally falling right out of the sky.
13213211111111111.title: Surfacing back up

132132111111111111.content:
Elma blasted off through the valley, soaring high into the air leap after leap in order to submit to her ongoing conquest. Four goals had just been completed scoring her 5 points. The sun hung low on the horizon and nightfall was imminent. The air was brisk and clean, almost feeling more fresh and natural than it ever did in real life upon that fateful night, or perhaps day. Elma wasn't sure how much time had even passed since he entered, but he could feel himself getting tired, so eventually he'd have to stop and save, if that was possible. He hoped it would be, Living as this character could be rather fun, like playing a real life videogame. Probably a lot preferable to something more casual, or the options that left him living some fetish fueled life.

She'd traveled for about half an hour when he finally came across a massive crater where the star had fallen. Fiery red streaks outlined the area was charred, from the rocks and to the dirt and pillars. Even the sky was slightly smogged, smoking around.Elma wasn't sure quite what to do, but a strange instinct kicked in and she felt like there was something she could. She hadn't thought about it or done such before, but she turned around and put her legs near the impact, rubbing and streaking them quickly through the ashen earth, and felt a jolt of energy unlike anything she'd ever felt yet.

The steam in her hydraulics intensified, and feet cycled like she was on a treadmill, as a blinding flash of steam and gusting wind scored through the area. When it was finished, the gorge was slightly damp, but less of a hazard. She could see a faint shadow in the center of it, and hopped towards it.

"I didn't know I had skill-sets like that. This girl's just full of surprises."

As the dust and debris settled, she could finally make out a figure within the mid-center, it was squirming and approaching her suddenly.

Elma wobbled her legs, which had taken on a great deal of strain and felt like an iron-press, heavy and hot since her last maneuver, as the figure finally stepped out of the shadows and clear into view. She looked vacantly as Elma, and Elma stared shocked back at her.

The star that Elma found, has been another girl.
132132111111111111.title: A new obstacle enters the game

1321321111111111111.content:
The plucky Gothic steampunk heroine, Elma Rosenberg, genius starchild and inventor, adventuer, child prodigy had just journeyed through deserted canyons, escaped surveillance drones up above, and seen wondrous sights deep into the mantle of the digital earth. But here in front of her now, was a sight her vigor and bravery couldn't but prepare her for, another girl in her midst.

The girl had crisp short, straight brunette-reddish hair to Elma's own elegant curls and shaggy mop. Her eyes watched Elma glassy and distorted, like those of a herder staring down their flock, poised yet detached. She wore a long coat and white cotton shirt underneath with a leathery pencil skirt. Atop her head and youthful face, her small button nose and wide glassy eyes, like dark marbles into the soul, despite their collected coolness and mystique gave little way for emotion. Her stance was tall and firm, but she wobbled over stilted and disoriented like a ruling figure using it's legs for the first time. She brushed her hair with an arm carefree and dismissive, and her expression changed not a wince from the stupor she gave off.

"Hello?" Elma said nervously.

The girl looked at Elma like she was the stupidest thing on the planet, turning her head and just barely giving back a delayed "Hi."

She walked forward, stilted and stricken, almost tipping over at times or seeming so. But she didn't faint or fall over, and despite the starchild's helping insistence, the star fallen child callously rejected her and pushed her helping hands away.

The girl sighed, "Where am I now?" examining her surroundings as she climbed out of the cooled off eradicated patches, sighting the dark horizon ahead.

Elma tapped her braced foot and winced. Who was this girl, and where did she come from? She had obviously been accounted for by the game somehow, since she was found after following one of it's goals, but she also had an agenda of her own. Was she an NPC to help him, another player, something else completely? The girl scarcely paid attention or gave her mind, and if she was truly a program she wasn't talkative or helpful like one at all.

The girl coldly asked Elma her name.

"E-Elma, Elma Rosenberg. What's uh, yours?" Elma stuttered.

"Anne von Tastle." The girl replied simply and calmly.
1321321111111111111.title: Introductions are in order, perhaps

13213211111111111111.content:
"Anne von Tastle." The girl had replied simply and calmly, almost coldly looking off into the world and pacing herself away.

"Hey, wait up!" Elma said. "You had uhhh, quite a fall back there. Are you okay miss?" She chased after the newly found Anne, who stopped in her tracks briefly after.

"Miss?" Anne folded her arms over.

"Miss T- Well, Anne. Are you okay?"

Anne looked at her body, slightly dirtied by the wreckage but otherwise in pristine and healthy conditions. She flicked her hair again and snubbed her nose up towards the sky. "I seem 'okay' enough, thank you for your concern." And just like that, she was off again.

The chase resumed. Anne walked slowly but composed, sighting her surroundings but not amused by them.

"Where did you fall from exactly? And who, or what, how are you?" Elma sprang back and forth like a lion playing with it's prey.

Anne continued walking. "The sky. Anne, who is a person as in a human being, and I'm fine, so thank you Rose?"

Elma stopped. "Rose?" She continued to bombard Anne with questions, trying and failing to even get her attention most of the time.

Flicking her head playfully, Anne scoweled. "What's your deal? What do you want?" Elma went silent. "You see how that feels?"

The two paced themselves in silence from there across the desert, the cliffs low and far apart now. Mounds and pillars could still be seen in the distance, but Anne walked with a sense of direction and mindfullness of someone poised for their next destination. When Elma finally got the courage to speak up again, she was 'Sssh'd' suddenly.

"How long have you been playing that?" Anne posed.

"P..playing?"

Not waiting for an answer, Anne shook her head, even a little confused herself at that comment.

"I mean, out here. How long have you been out here. And where should we rest? I just have a feeling that's what we're supposed to do.is all."

The two looked at each other, and quietly turned their head to north where dim lights and sights made their way up ahead, resembling something lively and suggesting of civilization from afar.

"There. We need to make our way over there." Anne told her. They started to make their way towards the long trek ahead, when Elma's visor popped game messages into her vision once again almost taking her by surprise. I'd been so long since she'd last gotten messages like that, had she really been in the game that long and already completed her first goal a time ago?

Second Objective: Find resting spot and 'Save.' Goal completion earns: 5 points. Third: objective: Make 'friends' with Anne von Tastle, get acquainted with her. Bond together. Rally somewhere safe. Goal completion earns, 15 Points. Points acquired currently: 5. 100 required points to complete and finish Game.


"Make friends, with this girl? This is going to be a heck of a game." Elma geared up her legs and prepared for the journey that awaited them.

Still at home, if a little different
1422.content:
'A ten year old with a black belt?' Daniel thought to himself. 'Man, I could be some kind of kickass girl.'

With that mindset, he selected the black belt option. After clicking on the controller, another bright flash came from the screen, blinding him once again. Once it cleared up, he found himself...
1422.title: Black belt

choices: Someone come to check on her
14221.content:
The light cleared and Danielle had to blink a couple times to familiarize herself with her new environment. The first thing that she noticed was the room he was in that looked like a cheap dojo, probably the one some of his elementary school friends mentioned going to back in the day. Then she noticed the small children of around, ranging from ages six to around twelve, and the twenty-something man that was going over random instructions. The last thing that she noticed was herself, namely that she was a she.

"The hell just happened?!" she cried out at seemingly random. All the other children looked at her in confusion.

"Danielle, what's wrong?" the strange man, who Danielle now saw was wearing a large gi similar to all the other kids.

"Uh..." the girl hesitated. "No, thanks for asking, Sensei Peter." Danielle held her tongue. How did she know the man's name? Also, why couldn't she stop thinking of herself as a her? "Sensei Peter, may I use the bathroom quick?"

"I don't see why not. Please hurry up, training begins in five minutes."

"Hai, sensei," she responded while giving an honorable bow that she immediately questioned herself for. Even stranger was how easy it was to locate the restrooms and how easy she chose to take the girl's. As soon as she walked inside, Danielle looked into the mirror and the reflection it gave. In it was a small girl that looked similar to Sophie when she was little, if a little different. To be specific, the girl had long brown hair tied into a ponytail, a cute face that resembled Daniel's when he was small, though obviously much more feminine, an earring in each ear, and black gi held with a black belt.
14221.title: In the middle of karate class

142212.content:
"Dani? Are you okay?"

Danielle jumped a bit at the sudden noise, emitting a little "eep" as she did. Almost as if by instinct, she whipped around and grabbed whoever's arm it belonged you, holding it behind their back.

"Ow! Dani, we're not training yet!"

Opening her eyes and loosening her grip, Danielle looked clearly at who she was almost pinning. It was a girl around her age, wearing the same gi, but with a white belt. She had some slight Asian features on her face, shoulder-length black hair tied by by a hairband, and green eyes. The expression on her face slowly shifted from surprise to amusement as she took Danielle's arms off of her.

"As much as I imagine you enjoy kicking my butt every time, couldn't you save it for the floor?" she asked with a slight giggle.

"Huh?" asked Danielle.

"What do you mean "huh"? Are you feeling alright?" the girl asked with some concern. However, Danielle's biggest problem was figuring out who this girl was. She didn't know anyone in whatever reality she was now in.

"Dani! Stacy! Come on!" shouted someone from outside, most likely one of the guys in the dojo. Stacy, as she was apparently called, grabbed Danielle's hand with a smile.

"Come on! We can't have our superstar missing training." she said. However, only one of those words registered on Danielle's brain as she was whisked through the door.

"Superstar?"
142212.title: Someone comes to check on her

1422122.content:
Stacy continued to drag her friend out across the dojo's hallway until they saw someone waiting at the end of the hall. There stood a small boy around Danielle age with a black black belt similar to her's seeming to be waiting against the wall with his arms crossed. He had short brown hair and a small frown on his face. As soon as he noticed the two girls looking at him weird, he broke into a cold sweat.

"W-what?" he asked while getting off the wall and awkwardly getting into a more neutral position.

"Why were you waiting for us, Kyle?" Stacy asked.

The boy, who Danielle now identified as Kyle, gave an incredulous look, obviously brought on by embarrassment. "I-I wasn't waiting for you! I was just...making sure Danielle was okay, you know. She seemed a little weird was all and I was a little worried is all." This was the point where Danielle realized what this boy really was.

"Stalker!" she suddenly blurted out while pointing at the boy.

"I'm not a stalker!" Kyle shouted back. "I was just worried was all."

"Kyle, we all know you have a crush on Danielle, there's no use denying it," Stacy said calmly. These words were enough to cause both black belts to turn red in the face and fuming angry.

"I do not have a crush on her!" the boy shouted.

"Yeah!" the girl I would never, I mean, he would-gah!" She started marching off before muttering "Creep."

"H-hey, I am not a creep!" Kyle then ran off in front of Danielle to make his point clear. "I am not a creep!"

How does Danielle react?
1422122.title: Along the way

14221222.content:
"Move it!"

Dani didn't feel like putting up with him, so she just bumped right past him taking a stop on the floor where she usually sat. She was still fuming about it, even when Stacy came over, with a sneaky smile on her face.

"Ah, you like him, don't you?"

"Shut up!"

"Oh come on. He's as good as you are, but he doesn't know how to express it. I think you two would work out anyway." Stacy said.

"Why would I think of him? He's a wimp." Dani retorted. Quite frankly, she didn't know why she was so abrasive. She was hardly like this outside of whatever weird game this was.

"Stacy, I...." she started.

"Oh, sensei's starting." said Stacy.

With that said, their sensai began the day's training. It all seemed to go so fast for Dani, almost as if she was on autopilot. Still, she was amazed when she could do things that she definitely didn't have the flexibility for as Daniel. Still, she got quite a few remarks from other girls in the class, all wondering about Kyle. It got kind of annoying. Was this was little girls talked about when guys weren't around?
14221222.title: She ignores him

142212221.content:
Of course, the teasing didn't just stop after training, as it continued all throughout the students' lunch break. Danni was surprised to find the small, pink backpack she had brought to her class with all the supplies she needed, including a plain blue lunchbox for her break. In it, she found a small turkey sandwich exactly the way she liked it: tomatoes, mustard, and pickles. She hadn't had this kind of sandwich since she was a kid! Granted, she was basically a kid again now.

Danni decided it best to sit in a corner of the dojo with Stacy considering she felt the safest around her. In fact, she was starting to feel legitimately close to the girl, even letting out a girlish giggle at a number of her admittedly juvenile jokes. Though, for whatever reason, Danni was not afraid to do so, as she was already starting to feel at ease of her new role. That was except for the aforementioned teasing, obviously.

Even as she was just trying to eat the remains of her sandwich or drink from her juice box, every single girl in the class surrounded Danni with the sole purpose of constantly trying to get some kind of scoop on her relationship with Kyle. They kept on saying how the two were both the best fighters they had, so it made sense for the two to hook up. That was without mentioning their constant bickering, of which some of the girls likened to that of an old married couple. After a while, Danni was just one small push away from cracking.

It was at that moment of instability that Kyle came over the girls asking, "Could you give Danni some room, please? I think she's had enough." The mere sound of the boy's voice was enough to cause her to involuntarily punching him in the face. Hard.

"Ow!" he yelled while grasping his face. It took him awhile to release it, revealing a bloodied nose. "What the hell was that for?!"

"I can fight my own battles!" Danni answered. All the kids in the class ooed and awed at her actions. Of course, this didn't escape the attention of Sensei Peter.
142212221.title: Lunch break

1422122211.content:
Long story short, things didn't go well for Dani after that little spat. Kyle was fine, but Sensei Peter wasn't too fond of it. Before too long, Dani was waiting for her parents outside, now in her street clothes.

"Sorry about that Dani." said Stacy.

"It's fine. I guess one day won't kill me." said Dani. This whole game had been one convoluted mess for Dani. Being this little girl, while being great at karate, was a heck of a lot of trouble to deal with. Anyway, she soon saw the car pull up, seeing her Mom come out. Guess that hadn't changed at all in this world. She wasn't happy at all of course, something Dani noted all the way back to home, which also looked the same.

"You will think about what you did, okay?" said Mom sternly.

"Fine." Danielle said as she went with her Mom inside the house. "Everything is really the same. Not exactly the big change I was imaging."

"What was that?" asked Mom.

"Oh nothing." said Danielle. There wasn't much else other than going to her room now. This game was already a bit of a headache. Dani began to wonder if the bedroom housed the logout or whatever.
1422122211.title: Dani is punished

14221222111.content:
As soon as Danielle reached her room, she honestly didn't feel to wrong with it. At first, she was expecting nothing but pink, dolls, and frilly pillows. Instead, she just saw a baby blue painted room with a rather normal wooden bed covered in light brown sheets. There were still a few dolls from her more girly childhood and her closet was a little bit bigger, but everything still looked similar to Daniel's room as a child.

"God, I need a break," Danielle groaned before crashing on her bed. She turned on her head to see the TV in front of her bed surprisingly already turned on, with a strange message flashing on it. It was a screen similar to the one from when she started the accursed game. On it shown the words "New Objective Unlocked" in a bold, fashionable text, along with the text "Press A to Accept."

"Might as well see what else this game has to offer." She grabbed one of the controllers laying on the lamp shelf next to her and quickly pressed the A button. On the screen now shown "Congratulations on your first adventure with The Reality Game: Girl's Edition! It appears that you have chosen the life of Karate Student: Age 10. As such, your first objective is simply this: Win a one-on-one fight." At the bottom of the screen were two options: one that asked to press A to continue and another to quit.

"Wait, so I can just quit right now if I want?" Danielle asked herself.
14221222111.title: New Bedroom

142212221111.content:
At least Danielle actually knew what the objective was now. Still, things were pretty hectic today, and she began to figure that it was a good idea to take a breather for now.

"I'll do it later." Danielle spoke to herself before selecting the "Log Out" option on the screen. As soon as that happened, things faded out.

*****Real World*****

Just like that, Daniel woke up in his room again, perfectly normal. He looked back at the clock in his room. It had only been about 10 minutes or so since he logged in.

"Only 10 minutes? Wow."

With that said, Daniel shook his head and went downstairs. It was past 6:00 now, so dinner was likely done, or at least close to it. Soon enough, dinner was set, with the whole family at the dinner table. Daniel was asked about the new game, so which he thought that it was pretty good. His Mom and Dad had no clue about the fact that he had a female version or the fact that he was a 10-year old karate girl in that world. He didn't want to say anything to freak them out. After that, dinner was soon complete, and Sophie walked up to Daniel.

"So, how much fun was it to be a little girl?" she asked.

"Well, I ended up beating up one of the classmates." Daniel sighed, getting a laugh from Sophie.

"You actually did that? That's funny." she laughed again. "So how long where you there? I read that each day in the game is about 10 minutes in real time."

"I didn't keep track, thought I did go through most of the class and had lunch. I also had to be taken home. So, I'd say it was a good amount of time." said Daniel.

"Interesting. I wonder how things will be the next time you go in. I can't wait to hear about it." smiled Sophie.

"Yeah, me too." Daniel smiled back.
142212221111.title: Danielle logs out

1422122211111.content:
That night, Daniel laid on his bed, thinking about the game. He had to admit, it felt so much more than just a game, which he supposed it was. It was weird, really. Normally, Daniel would never want to be a little girl, no matter how awesome or limber she was. Still, there was an entire world he could visit at a whim! He stared at the screen, where the screen simply said to press A to continue, and thought about whether or not to return to his other life a little bit longer.

'Wait, if a whole day is only ten minutes, then a night there wouldn't get me any sleep here,' he thought to himself. 'Best if I sleep here first.' With that resolved, he tried to go to sleep. However, as he did, he couldn't stop thinking about the game. It soon got to the point where he just laid on the side of his bed staring at the screen. Every second, he was starting to feel more and more curious as to how a good night's sleep would be in the game.

It was at that moment he heard a scuffle. At first, Daniel thought he might just have a rat roaming his room. Then, he noticed a dark blob within the darkness.

"Sophie!" he yelled at the unveiling blob. There stood Daniel's younger sister with a defeated look on her face. "No wonder I couldn't get any sleep. Why were you creeping in my room?!"

"I only just came in!" she defended. "I was just interested in the game is all and wanted to find out some more is all."

"So you sneaked into my room?"

"I just wanted to see the instruction manual or maybe see if there was some archive footage or something. I really want to see how you are as a little girl."

"Get the hell out of my room!" Daniel yelled while pointing at the door. Sophie just stood there and glanced at the screen. followed by the controller. Then came her trademark devilish grin.

"I'm sorry, did you say you were having trouble sleeping?" she asked with her creepy smile. "Well, you should know that pre-teens have a considerably lower metabolism rate." She darted towards the controller before Daniel could even react and quickly pressed the A button. Daniel's vision was followed by a bright light, followed by a calming darkness.
1422122211111.title: That Night

Just for laughs, Daniel selected alien. Immediately upon selecting that option, a laser light hit him in the face, momentarily blinding him. When the light faded, he found himself in his normal room. Only his, or rather, her sister, Sophie and her brother, Toby were staring at her with their eyes wide open in shock.

"Wat?" not noticing his new voice or accent, she asked. "Wat's rong?"

"Um... Daniel, you might want to look in the mirror." wincing, Sophie said.

Daniel turned to his full length mirror, hanging on her closet door. Instead of the boy who had always greeted her there, she saw a tall, teenage, alien girl. She had soft fury green skin, long brown hair with green highlights, two large blue eyes, two arms with five (six inch) tentacles instead of fingers, and two human like legs. The girl staring back at Daniel had a perfect hourglass figure with a modest bust and muscles that would make any football player envious.

"Wat happened to me!?" in a soft melodious voice, she asked.

"You chose to be an alien exchange student in this new reality." smiling, Todd replied. "I must say, you make a pretty cute alien girl."

Sophie giggled. "I have to agree." smiling, she said. "What planet are you from?"

"I am from Wat u woud call a parallel world." without thinking, Daniel replied. "Our Earth developed much differently than your own." she paused. "How did I know this?"

"The game must have programed your mind with that information for the game." mussing, Sophie said. "Why don't you look at your game goal options so we can continue."

Daniel looked at the screen and wondered what game goal she should select....
1432.title: Alien.

14321.content:
"Ze most difficult task fer anyone, especially an alien, is to mak friends in a world where u look different from anyone else." selecting the option, you said. "Zis should be interesting."

Upon hitting the selection, a new message flashed upon the screen.

'You must make one best friend, two good friends, and four pen pals before the school year ends to win this level. Click next to continue.'

"Wat!?" surprised, you asked. "Any other surprises?"

Daniel hit 'next' and the second message appeared....

'You are the first alien being to participate in the inter dimensional exchange student program. You must avoid the press while obtaining your goal to make friends. Good Luck. The game begins.'

Just as Daniel read this, mom knocked on the door and peered inside. "Ah, Daniel, I see you are awake." smiling, she said. "School does not start for another week; would you like to go to the mall to buy your school uniform?"

Daniel gulped. "Uniform?" nervous, she asked.

Sophie giggled. "Didn't I tell you, Daniel?" amused, she asked. "Our school is starting a uniform policy this coming year. You and I will have to wear a short skirt, blouse, and jacket with a bow."

Daniel sighed. "If I must, I must."

"I'll tell you what." smiling, mom said. "Let's make this a girls' day out. I'll treat you to the royal works. A pampering salon make over, some new clothes...."

"What about me?" wincing, Toby asked.

Mom giggled. "Oh, I'm sure we can you pretty too." teasing, she said.

Daniel giggled at mom's joke.

15322.content:
"Game entry successful, now entering player two." A light shone on Daniel's sister Sophie and scanned her thoroughly.

"Wait, what? I don't remember it saying anything about two players. Stop!" Sophie tried to run quickly but the light engulfed her. She felt strangely warm, like she was in a bath or puddle caressing her body.

When she woke up, she stumbled onto a shiny wooden floor. Silken stockings and a leotard coated her bottom half, and her hair was done in a nice neat bun.

She had entered the game as..
15322.title: Select stats for player two

153221.content:
Sophie was in a pink leotard with a tutu, and another girl dressed the same way was rubbing her eyes right beside her.

"What happened?" Danielle asked.

"You gals bumped into each other and fell down, but it looks like your both okay now." Their ballet teacher, Jennifer Smith, told them. "Do you need to sit out for a while?"

"I think I'll be fine." Danielle replies.

"I'm okay to dance Ms. Jenn!" Sophie says.

"Great! Then lets continue!" Ms. Jenn says enthusiastically.

After another thirty minutes of practicing for this coming Friday's ballet recital, the class was dismissed. Sophie's mom picked them up and put them into their booster seats.

"How did you girls enjoy class?" Sophie's mom asked.

"I had fun!" Sophie exclaims.

"How did you like your first class, Danielle?"

"I liked it, Auntie Lucy, but I thought that I told you I like Dani better?" Dani retorts back.

Lucy giggles. "Sorry, Dani, I forget."

After another five minutes of driving, they arrive at Sophie's house. Dani was staying there while her parents were on a month long cruise around the Mediterranean Sea.

"Can we watch Spongebob, Mom?" Sophie asks.

"Of course you can, but in a couple of hours, we're going to sit down for supper."

"Okay, Mom."

After about thirty minutes of watching Spongebob, Sophie starts giggling and looking at Dani weird. Sophie is about to ask what she's laughing about, until she starts remembering everything.

"Gosh darnit!" Dani tries to swear. "How did we get into this?"

"I don't know, but I'm having fun, and you look cute as four year old girl." Sophie is giggling again.

Dani pouts. "Yeah, yeah. How long do we have to be in here for?"

Sophie pulls up the Tasks option. "It looks like we have two weeks to complete our tasks. If we don't, then our real world bodies and lives will be changed to match our current bodies and lives."

The color drains out of Dani's face at that. "How many tasks to we have to complete?"
