Where do they end up?
15332211.title: Start game

153322112.content:
Danielle stirs as she starts waking up. It's Saturday morning, and the sun is shining through the window to her and Sophie's room. Danielle sits up groggily and yawns in a cute voice. She rubs her right eye with her fist and looks over at Sophie's bed. It looks like Sophie woke up earlier and went down for some breakfast and cartoons.

Danielle crawls out of bed and slowly makes her way downstairs. She tries to comb some of the tangles out of her hair with her fingers as she's going. She makes it to the landing and sees her twin sister sitting on the floor in front of the T.V. eating a bowl of Fruit Loops. Sophie is watching an episode of Spongebob on Nickelodeon. Danielle wants to join her, so she walks a little faster to the kitchen. She finds her Mom sitting at the table with a cup of coffee.

"Well, hello, Sleepyhead!" She says, cheerily.

"Morning, Mommy!" Danielle smiles at her.

"Do you want Fruit Loops like your sister, or do you want something else?" She asks, heading to the cereal cupboard.

"I want Peanut Butter Crunch!"

"As always." Her Mom sighs. "So, are you excited for your first day of swimming lessons, Pumpkin?"

"Yes!" Danielle replies, ecstatic.

"They start at two this afternoon. That means that we need to start getting ready at one. Go ahead and watch some Spongebob with Sophie. I'll come in to turn the T.V. off when we need to get ready."

"Thanks, Mommy!" Danielle gives her Mom a quick kiss on the cheek, takes her cereal, and walks to the living room. She sits down right beside her sister and starts eating.

"Peanut Butter Crunch, again?" Sophie says.

"Yes, Fruit Loops, again?" Danielle retorts.

"Of course." Sophie replies.

After this exchange, they sit quietly as they watch Spongebob, laughing every now and then. Sophie starts giggling a little and looks over to Danielle.

"What? Did I spill on my night shirt?" Danielle asks and looks down.

"Nope, just thinking about the joke we played on Mommy last night." Danielle starts giggling too. However, that isn't the reason why Sophie started giggling in the first place.

Their Mom eventually comes in and turns the T.V. off. "Time to get ready. We don't want to be late for swimming lessons. Do we?"

"No, Mommy." Danielle and Sophie reply in unison. The three of them head upstairs where their Mom braid their hair, get them into their one-piece, pink swim suits, and puts sun screen on them.

"Alright, you two wait by the door while I get my purse and keys."

Danielle and Sophie wait by the front door while their Mom into the kitchen. Suddenly, Danielle remembers everything.

"Woah!" Danielle exclaims. "We're in a game, aren't we?"

"You just now remembered?" Sophie giggles.

"Yeah, when did you remember?"

"About an hour ago. You thought I was laughing at what we did last night."

"Oh." Danielle says. "How long are we in the game for?"

"Until we can complete some goals."

"Okay." Danielle figures out how to view her goals.

How many does she need to complete?
153322112.title: At home, just waking up

1533221121.content:
"It looks like we need to complete five goals." Sophie says.

Danielle looks over them.

1. Be able to jump into the water without holding your nose.

2. Be able to french braid your sisters hair.

3. Get fully potty trained.

4. Be able to swim completely underwater for ten full seconds.

5. Pass the summer's swimming lesson final.

These goals do not have to be done in order of appearance.

"It looks like we have to do more than just swim in this game." Sophie says.

"I guess so, Sissy." Danielle says, nervous at getting the potty training done.

Sophie giggles. "Did you just call me Sissy?"

Danielle thinks about it. "I must've. I guess I'm getting into the story some."

"Don't I know it, Sissy." Sophie says smiling.

"Are you girls ready to go?" Their Mom asks after returning to the front door.
1533221121.title: 5 goals

choices: The game malfunctioned and a rule has changed.

*****Apartment #303 (Game World)*****

*BEEP* *BEEP* *BEEP*

One sleepy arm reached out and stopped the alarm clock, as the sunny rays of the morning shone into the apartment room. Trisha Johnson, a 28-year old woman, slowly rose from her bed, holding her blanket against her bare chest. She rubbed her eyes, getting used to the sun as she smiled. It looked to be another great day. Days always seemed to be like this during summer. She briefly looked down, seeing that she often didn't wear anything during summer. It was kind of hot for that. Oh well, she was on her own anyways. It was time to get ready for the day anyway.

She walked out and showered, making sure every bit of her long blond hair was nice and clean. Right afterwards, after she turned the water off, she dried her hair off and grabbed a towel, wrapping it around her torso as she walked out to get some breakfast. Still wearing just the bath towel, she walked to her kitchen area where she tried putting together a bagel among other things.

Suddenly, she heard buzzing from her right. She turned to see her smartphone buzzing. She walked straight over to see something from someone named Ashley.

"Hey girl, don't forget practice today, okay?"

Just as she read that message, the lights went on in Trisha's head, causing her to fall back a bit. Reopening her eyes, she looked around in confusion. Was this the game? She looked down and immediately blushed, seeing nothing but a towel hiding her DD breasts. Suddenly feeling a bit self-conscious about it, Trisha looked around a bit frantically.

"This is the game world? I'm really a woman?" she asked herself. If the text was true, then she really was now. And if this really was the game world, then she had cheerleading to do, and probably lots of it.
155211.title: Enter the game reality

1552111.content:
Before Trisha could even consider her situation any further, she heard another buzzing sound from her phone. Looking down at the smartphone she had dropped, she saw another text had came in, albeit from an unknown source. Looking at it, she saw it read "Congratulations on your first adventure with The Reality Game: Girl's Edition! It appears that you have chosen the life of Professional Cheerleader: Age 28.! As such, your first objective is simply this: Complete a single day of practice."

The cheerleader just stared at the phone for a good while. All of this seemed so surreal to the woman, especially since she wasn't a woman but minutes ago. Or, maybe not. As much as Trisha remembered being a boy, she also remembered plenty of being a girl, a woman in fact! She remembered her daily routine, her dancing routines, her health diet, everything!

"This is just fucking weird," she said out loud, glad she had no authority figure to call on her or half-pint to tell on her. It was with that thought that she realized something: she had a different family now. Wherever his parents, Sophie, or Toby were didn't matter in this reality, as here she was born a Johnson instead of an Andrews. Trisha walked on over to her living room wall to see all the photos that hung. There, in the glossy pictures above, were her new parents, Karin and Henry, and her little brother Chris. She actually cracked a smile at the view of Chris, finding it rather ironic how she had a fifteen year old boy as a younger sibling now.

The amusement was brief, though, as Trisha remembered the practice that her BFF Ashley reminded her of, along with the game's challenge. She walked back into her personal room and got out her gym bag with her more casual wear before taking out her Denver Broncos' cheerleader uniform. Unlike most of the other fellow peers, Trisha always preferred to come to practice in her full uniform first, instead of just changing into it in the locker room. She couldn't help but giggle a little at how she ended up as a woman that seemed to like to wear as little clothes as possible. The rest of her immodest wardrobe seemed to draw that conclusion as well.

"Well, at least this'll be an interesting life," she said to herself in the mirror before putting on her uniform. Trisha blushed a little bit once she was forced to see her new bare body in full consciousness, but the awkwardness was fading as she became more used to her beautiful body. Once she garbed herself in her proper attire, she got her purse, her phone, and her keys before heading out to her car.
1552111.title: Finding out the goal

15521111.content:
"Well, this car looks nice."

Trisha saw the girl she was apparently going to use for this body. It was a pretty nice one too; a black Dodge Charger. She went right in, crossing her legs a bit as she turned the car on and began moving. Frankly, Trisha didn't know how she knew where to go. Guess it seemed like the game was taking charge in some areas. She still remembered that this was a game, yet this "Trisha" life seemed almost as real.

She could remember all the routines, but she wondered how the actual practice would go, since it was given to her as a goal. To be honest, Trisha wondered if anything would happen once the goal was finished. Guess she'd have to wait and see.

Unfortunately, the Denver traffic was bad this morning, and she didn't really leave early to begin with. It was frustrating, and it always seemed to happen at the most inconvenient time. She looked at the car clock, seeing that it was a little past 9:00, which was the start time.

Eventually, she arrived at Dove Valley, and she immediately exited, as if on autopilot. She could see some of the others already warming up, and the head cheerleader, Diane, didn't look happy.

"Trisha, did you sleep in?" she asked sternly.

"I didn't wake up that late, but I'm sorry." Trisha apologized.

"Just make sure it doesn't happen again. So get warmed up since we're about to start."

After that, Trisha could see Ashley, giving her a knowing look as if she wasn't surprised. Anyway, Trisha was able to put her valuables away, getting out to the floor again. She started to stretch, the boy part of her mind amazed at her flexibility.

"This should be a fun practice." she smiled.
15521111.title: Arriving at the stadium

155211112.content:
"Okay, girls," Diane announced with an aura of authority, "time to hit the gym."

"Wait, what?" Trisha asked confused.

"Man, you're brain must be late as well," Ashley giggled while slapping her friend's back. "C'mon, let's go to the gym and get all warmed up. Weren't you planning on beating your weight lifting record?"

"My what?"

"Oh, just come on!" Ashley sighed as she grabbed her best friend and dragged her into the cheerleaders' private exercise room. There was equipment everywhere, from treadmills to ellipticals to exercise bikes to regular weight benches, with a couple TVs playing either local news or soap operas running. All the other cheerleaders got to one thing or another, some chatting amongst themselves, the rest motivating themselves with their own thoughts. Trisha was amazed at the sight of all the women working out like this, but not like he would be as a teenage boy. Rather than be aroused by all of them, she was more impressed at just how fit they all kept themselves.

"Well, better get to lifting~!" Ashley chirped while giving her friend a big push towards the nearest weight bench. Trisha reluctantly got on it and started to lift the fifty pound weights on it rather easily. She was surprised at how strong this body actually was. Heck, it was probably even stronger than her old one!

"Okay, adding weights!" Before Trisha could question her friend, she began to feel additional weights being added, causing her former tranquil lifting to become a little more stressed. Then, Ashley added another ten pounds, followed by another. By now, Trisha was now lifting eighty pounds and beginning to struggle greatly. "Come on, Trish, don't give up now!" Another ten pounds, even more of a struggle. By now, she was having trouble lifting the weights. "Just one more!" Ashley added began to add another weight while Trisha was still holding the bar in midair, only to accidentally cause her friend to fall off the bench just by adding to one side.

Trisha ended up falling on the ground of the gym hard, the bar barely missing her neck while falling with her. The entire rest of the cheerleaders just stood there looking at their fellow teammate's near death experience.

"S-sorry!" Ashley apologized while helping sad teammate up.

"This freaking game's going to kill me," she muttered underneath her breath.

"What was that?"

"N-nothing," Trisha brushed off. "I think I'll go lay down for awhile." With that, the two went by the nearest bench, where Trisha practically passed out.
155211112.title: Other Choice

1552111121.content:
After a little bit, Trisha seemed to come to, feeling herself being nudged awake by Ashley.

"Trisha, you all right?" As she spoke, Trisha seemed to remember what had happened before, with what happened with the weights. She nodded at Ashley, saying that she was fine, getting herself up from the bench.

"So, you ready to finish?" she asked.

"Sure, what's left?" Trisha asked.

"Just a little more on our routines for the next game is all." explained Ashley.

"Oh, okay."

Truth be told, Trisha didn't feel really up to it. Remembering what this game was, Trisha didn't exactly feel very confidant about it. She remembered that the goal set for her was to finish a practice, but that last event had left her a bit shaky. Just how was she supposed to handle something like that anyway? Well, there wasn't much to do about it now. She had to finish this, otherwise it would look very suspicious. With that in mind, she walked over with Ashley to where the other girls were, who also asked if Trisha was fine. She smiled a bit, seeing how worried they were.

Anyway, the coach got them together to at least finish up the routines. It all kind of flew by for Trisha, as if she was on autopilot. Perhaps it was because she wasn't really in the mood, but she would have time to sort it out later.
1552111121.title: Waking up for more practice

15521111211.content:
Once practice seemed to fly by in a flash, Trisha immediately changed into her casual wear and headed to her car. She purposely ignored the rest of her teammates, just so she could return home and hopefully think this entire game thing over. One near-death experience was enough for one day. However, just as she was about to start the engine, she felt her phone vibrate once again, signifying another text. Sighing, Trisha took it out, only to see another text from the game.

"Challenge completed! Congratulations! You have earned: 5 points." Inwardly, she was hoping for a bit more of a reward for almost getting her head smashed in. Still, the text was followed by another one: "New challenge: Collect groceries! List is located in notes."

"Groceries?" she sighed to herself before switching to more personal thoughts. 'Well, I suppose if I live all by myself, I would need to get my own food and all that. At least I should be loaded with a job like this.' With that in mind, Trisha started up her car and left for the nearest market. Like before, there seemed to be a GPS in her mind that allowed to know exactly where to go. Before long, she had already arrived at the local Winn-Dixie.

Upon entering, Trisha whipped out her phone and went to her notes to inspect her shopping list. All she needed was the essentials: meant, vegetables, microwavable meals, soft drinks (though only a single two-liter. Guess she just had to uphold a certain figure.), milk, and eggs. She maneuvered through the aisles with relative ease and collected all of her items in little time. Even despite never shopping for these things before, she still knew the best name brands to get and got nothing less.

Little time had passed before the cheerleader had everything she needed to checkout. However, just before she reached the front, Trisha noticed a rack of various wines. For whatever reason, basic impulses built into her body caused her to grab a random bottle and put it into her cart. Apparently the woman she was inhabiting had some various habits that were beyond her control. Still, with her loaded credit card, Trisha was outside the store in no time and headed back home. Though, not before she received a text announcing another five points well earned.
15521111211.title: Returning Home

info.brief_description: Daniel Andrews has just gotten a game that allows him to experience the lives of girls.
info.description:
Co-created with Scifiwizard and Sentinel!

The Reality Game, where one can explore multiple different lives. There are two versions of this game; one for boys and another for girls. Each version contains different lives that the player can explore. Here are some rules for the game:

1. The game changes reality for whoever goes into it, going right into the new life selected. There are several choices for each.
2. The player can save his or her progress to a thumb-drive and load it into another person's game in their home, allowing them to switch families in the altered reality.
3. Points earned in the game can be changed into cash in the altered reality that can be taken back with the player into his or her original reality.
4. Goals are set for each reality. For the football player, winning the national championships For the cheerleader, winning the national cheer leading competition.
5.Prolonged use of a single reality will cause the player to lose his or her memory and believe the altered reality is his or her own. (Much like becoming addicted to a game to the point you think you live in it.)
6. A female character can not return to her original reality if she becomes pregnant until the child is born. A male character can not return to his original reality if he gets a girl pregnant until the child is born.
7. Other setbacks will be power failure, damage to the controller or game system, a forgotten password, etc. Such a thing could result in the player being stuck in the game until further notice.

One day, Daniel Andrews receives a version of the game. The female version, to be exact. Unfortunately for him, it will land him in a very unusual situation.

Characters:

Daniel Andrews: 16 years old and a sophomore in high school. Short dirty blonde hair and blue eyes. A bit shy but also friendly with some friends.

Sophie Andrews: 14 years old and Daniel's little sister. Blonde hair past her shoulders with blue eyes. A typical little sister and a bit mischivious. Curious in seeing what her big brother would be like as a girl.

Toby Andrews: 7 years old and Daniel's little brother. Short brown hair with green eyes. Typical little brother.

Well, the rest of the rules are simple, really.

1. Keep it PG-13!
2. You can have sex, but not descriptive and try not to have too much.
3. Keep language PG-13 and also keep it tame (like not cursing every sentence)
4. Keep the story going and no killing the characters.
5. Try to make it a good length if possible.

Most importantly, have fun and write good! Write well! Write...just be awesome!
